sen.e: The Battle of Otsu-jo Castle took place from October 13, 1600 to October 21, 1600.

sen.j: 豊臣秀吉の死後、天下人の座を狙う徳川家康と、豊臣氏擁護の立場から家康と対立する石田三成ら反家康派の対立は、慶長5年の会津攻めを契機として表面化する。
sen.e: After Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI died, the opposition between Ieyasu TOKUGAWA, who set out to rule the world, and Mitsunari ISHIDA as a defender of the Toyotomi clan with anti-Ieyasu group came to the fore in the wake of the attack on Aizu in 1600.

sen.j: 石田三成は家康が会津攻めに赴いたことを好機として、大谷吉継や毛利輝元ら反家康派の諸大名を糾合して挙兵した。
sen.e: Taking the opportunity of Ieyasu's going off to attack Aizu, Mitsunari ISHIDA rallied anti-Ieyasu daimyos (feudal lords) such as Yoshitsugu OTANI and Terumoto MORI and took up arms.

sen.j: そして、家康が畿内を留守にしている隙をついて伏見城を落とし、次いで北陸地方や伊勢国伊勢方面の平定に乗り出していた。
sen.e: Then he captured the Fushiki-jo Castle exploiting Ieyasu's absence from Kinai region (provinces surrounding Kyoto and Nara), and after that he set out to suppress Hokuriku region and Ise area in Ise Province.

sen.e: Yoshitsugu OTANI, who was a daimyo in Tsuruga, Echizen Province, came to handle the suppression of Hokuriku area.

sen.j: そして、この北陸方面軍の一員として、近江国大津城の城主・京極高次が加わっていたのである。
sen.e: And as a member of Hokuriku area force Takatsugu KYOGOKU, the lord of Otsu-jo Castle in Omi Province, was in Yoshitsugu army.

sen.j: ところが高次は吉継が北陸から美濃国へと転進する最中に突如東軍に寝返り、手勢3000名を率いて大津城に籠城し防備を固め始めた。
sen.e: However, while Yoshitsugu was changing his course from Hokuriku area to Mino Province, Takatsugu suddenly switched to the East side, led his 3000 soldiers to Otsu-jo Castle and fortified the defense in there.

sen.j: この出来事に大坂城の淀殿は驚き、高次夫人に使者を遣わして（淀殿の妹である初（常高院）は高次の正室として城中にあった）、停戦・降伏を求めるが大津側は断固として拒否。
sen.e: Yodo-dono (Lady Yodo; Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI's concubine and the mother of Hideyori, the heir to the Toyotomi clan) was surprised to hear the treachery and dispatched an envoy to Takatsugu's wife (Yodo-dono's younger sister Hatsu/Joko-in was in Otsu-jo Castle as she was the Takatsugu's lawful wife) to call for truce and surrender but Otsu side never accepted it.

sen.j: これに対して西軍側は高次の裏切りに対する報復として、毛利元康を大将とし、それに立花宗茂、毛利秀包、筑紫広門ら九州方面の諸大名の軍勢を中心とした総勢1万5000人の軍勢をもって、慶長5年9月7日より大津城に対して包囲攻撃を開始した。
sen.e: In response the West squad started to besiege Otsu-jo Castle on October 13, 1600 with 15000-strong force mainly organized with daimyos in Kyushu areas such as Muneshige TACHIBANA, Hidekane MORI and Hirokado TSUKUSHI and led by Motoyasu MORI in retribution for Takatsugu's treachery.

sen.e: But Takatsugu defended the castle to the last and the siege didn't make good progress.

sen.j: 攻めあぐねた寄せ手は、十三日には大砲を城内に撃ち込んだ。

sen.e: Takatsugu defended hard but a spearhead convoy led by Kichiemon TACHIBANA from the Tachibana force reached castellated wall.

sen.j: 高次をはじめとする京極勢は奮戦したが遂に力尽き、9月15日に降伏して大津城を開城する。
sen.e: Takatsugu and other Kyogoku forces fought up but ran out of steam in the end and surrendered the castle on October 21.

sen.j: 高次は一命を助けられ、高野山に上って出家することとなる。

sen.e: The West squad won tactically at this siege of Otsu-jo Castle but was defeated strategically.

sen.e: In fact, after Muneshige had made Takatsugu surrender Otsu-jo Castle on October 21, he and his troops advanced to Kusatsu city, where he knew the rout of the West squad and was forced to retreat to Osaka-jo Castle, and after the battle he forfeited the rank of Samurai and properties.

sen.j: なお、敗軍の将である京極高次に対して、家康はあの立花宗茂をよく押さえてくれたということから、関ヶ原後に高次の弟・京極高知を使者として高野山に派遣し、大名としての復帰を許しただけではなく、若狭国一国小浜城9万2000石 (単位)の所領を与えるなど、宗茂を大津城に引き付けたことを大いに賞賛したという。
sen.e: Also, Ieyasu praised Takatsugu KYOGOKU very much for attracting Muneshige TACHIBANA to Otsu-jo Castle and containing him, so after the Battle of Sekigahara he sent Takatomo KYOGOKU, Takatsugu's younger brother, to Koyasan and not only allowed him to return as a daimyo but also gave him territories of Obama-jo Castle 92000 koku (unit) in Wakasa Province.
